attributes.action: No To British Intervention In Syria
attributes.additional_details:
The New York Times made it explicitly clear that there is: ‘no legal basis for military action. Nor does it cite Chapter 7 of the United Nations Charter, which authorizes the use of force.’

This is whole situation is similar to that of 2003, the people don't want another war, ISIS is a result of the last one we had, killing Bin Laden solved nothing.
attributes.background: After the recent recent attacks in Paris it appears as though people are allowing themselves to be whipped into a frenzy. Bombing Syria will only make the problem worse, therefore the West's presence is superfluous. We must NOT be railroaded into another disastrous invasion.
